alert.note: Alert for Southern Twin Falls County; Western Magic Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Twin Falls and Jerome Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Magic Valley Regional Airport, or near Twin Falls, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Twin Falls and Kimberly around 230 PM MDT. Hansen around 240 PM MDT. Eden and Minidoka National Monument around 250 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Southern Twin Falls County; Western Magic Valley
